title: 1 Peter: Living Hope
objective: Anchor identity in new birth and living hope while embracing holy exile living.

required_passages.text: He has caused us to be born again to a living hope... you are a chosen race... sojourners and exiles... by his wounds you have been healed.

segments.audio_script: Peter writes to believers under pressure, reminding them who they are in Christ.

Listen to 1 Peter 1-2. Peter praises God for new birth into living hope through Jesus' resurrection. He calls believers to holiness and sincere love. As living stones, they form a spiritual house and royal priesthood. He urges honorable conduct among unbelievers and points to Christ's suffering example and healing work.
Scattered churches faced social marginalization and hostility in the Roman world.
Identity drives ethics: chosen people live as holy exiles. Suffering is reframed by Christ's patternâ€”entrusting ourselves to the faithful Judge while doing good.
Key themes include living hope, holiness, exile identity, priesthood of believers, honorable witness, and Christ's suffering.
Reflect on this: Does your daily conduct reflect your identity as a holy exile and royal priest?
Living hope produces holy witness. Next, Peter addresses suffering relationships and steadfast shepherding.
